text: cool,  I think i will have to learn twisted a little before reading this !
<@U3ADJU5MZ> Let me know if you find a good tutorial on that!

hello...I have a couple of Ubuntu VMs running sawtooth validators.. I am trying to see if I can use docker swarm to see if I can get the validators in a single network.. I have initialised docker swarm in one node and made it as the master.. and added the other node as a worker node.. Is there a way to create a service for sawtooth validators using swarm?

<@U24M29R4G> - probably the closest thing we have to that is the work in the 'sawtooth cluster' command, and in particular the docker and docker-tng backends (docker-tng uses docker-compose, but doesn't run a full validator yet) - nothing docker-swarm specific

Hi @amundson...thanks for reply...I guess.. I have been trying to see how I can spin a bunch of docker based validators across a few Ubuntu VM hosts.. Will we be able to do the existing sawtooth cluster commands to acheive this? or What would be the best way to approach this problem?
I have been trying to see if i can use consul or zookeeper for service discovery for multihost networking.. But I just want to see if there is already an existing way which I am unaware of..
Also what is docker-tng? Is there any documentation available for the new enhancements that is being worked on from a sawtooth architecture perspective?
tng was the code name for the 0.8 work we have in-progress. I'll see if I can pull together some docs in the next few days.
<@U24M29R4G> I don't think there is any existing work with respect to consul/zookeeper/docker-swarm/etc.
<@U0YQQRNU8>.. thanks for the update on the docs and multi-host deployment using docker based validators..
